channel.title: Homes on Van der Laan & Science
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Van der Laan & Science

item.description: Biography I am an assistant professor in the Central Diagnostics Laboratory which is part of the Circulatory Health Program at the University Medical Center Utrecht and University of Utrecht and work with professor dr. Folkert W. Asselbergs and professor dr. Gerard Pasterkamp. My research interest is focused on the genetic and epigenetic causes of carotid and coronary atherosclerosis underlying ischemic stroke (IS) and coronary artery disease (CAD), and their intermediate traits such as carotid intima media thickness (cIMT) and arterial calcification.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I am one of the lecturers for the following courses and years: Cardiovascular Epidemiology [EP20]: Guest lecturer on cardiovascular genetic epidemiology (2020) | MSc Epidemiology | Erasmus MC - Netherlands Institute for Health Sciences BMW32416: Vascular Biology (since 2010) | BSc Biomedical Sciences | University of Utrecht GNBA221506: Healthy arteries: the role of the arterial wall and the circulation (since 2010) | BSc Medicine | University of Utrecht MSc Epidemiology: Cardiovascular genetics: Mendelian Randomisation and power (since 2017) | MSc Epidemiology | Julius Center - University Medical Center Utrecht You can find the teaching material here at the lectures project.
